column4:
Senate Republicans just voted to put American and Louisiana workers, families, and businesses first. 

Democrats again killed the bill and snuffed out hope for the #coronavirus relief Louisiana families so desperately need. https://t.co/d64ttWd1gG

Last time the Senate voted to send #coronavirus relief to Louisiana families and businesses, 52 Republicans supported the bill. 

So where's the aid? Every single, solitary Senate Democrat who voted blocked it.

There’s no reason to delay the #SCOTUS hearings. If @senjudiciary members don’t want to be there in person, they can appear virtually. 

We’ve got masks, we’ve got social distance, we’ve got a job to do, and we can do it safely. https://t.co/Dj2WU4DYbg

I’ve worked to ensure FEMA’s disaster relief fund gets the increase needed to take care of people hurt by storms and the #coronavirus pandemic. 

This $17 billion infusion means Louisianians can take heart that the resources they need are there for them.

https://t.co/REcdYbZmbp

Louisiana is still fighting the #coronavirus pandemic, and this $7.5M will support key health projects and research in New Orleans, Lafayette, and Shreveport.

https://t.co/T1yuYmGdIJ

Small businesses represent 97% of employers in Louisiana—that’s nearly 1 million Louisiana jobs.

These businesses needed cash flow to survive the #coronavirus crisis. 

Now they need those loans forgiven to rebuild from Hurricane #Laura.

https://t.co/V9MQUQUuRD

The sick people who abuse innocent animals often turn their violence on innocent people. 

The Animal Cruelty Enforcement Act would help prevent and punish animal cruelty.

https://t.co/15HJbFdHhJ

First responders save lives. 

Protestors who block these heroes from the people who need them may think their actions are political, but, in reality, they’re criminal.

The Stop Blocking Hospitals Act makes that crystal clear.

https://t.co/MmTykvoOfr

Louisianians have faced the #coronavirus and Hurricane Laura with courage. 

Giving tax relief to people and businesses hit hard by natural disasters is a no-brainer. Glad to work with @SenBillCassidy on this.

https://t.co/A1THhtTKap

Love your dog, cat, or bird? My pups Charlie and Jack are part of our family.

I just introduced the PUPS Act to help keep pets and people safe and TOGETHER during public health emergencies like the #coronavirus.

https://t.co/guKiM7TwIZ

52 Senate Republicans just voted to give Americans aid for unemployment, small business, schools, child care, and fighting the #coronavirus. 

Meanwhile, Democrats are holding out for a $1 trillion bailout of NY and California governments. https://t.co/rtJpecEGbf

Lafayette will benefit greatly from this $10M investment in the University Avenue Corridor Project. 

I’m thankful that DOT has prioritized improving Louisiana's infrastructure, especially as we work to recover from both a pandemic and Hurricane #Laura.

https://t.co/FJGEIZ0ka9

Today, the Senate votes on targeted help for families, kids, and workers hurt by the #coronavirus.

I bet if Sen. Schumer would release them, a number of Democrats would join Republicans in helping restart the economy that government shut down. https://t.co/v0DyYccKY3

We must ensure residents have access to quality health care as we recover from Hurricane #Laura. This $2.7M from HHS will help Louisiana health centers respond to and prepare for disasters.

https://t.co/y3QhNN1LXG

Hurricane #Laura hit as a category 4 storm, in the middle of a #coronavirus pandemic that already battered Louisiana. 

Laura’s winds topped 170 mph. We’re asking the Senate for emergency supplemental aid because our people need it. https://t.co/mFNZOtiUsA

We’re just beginning to rebuild communities devastated by #Laura, yet we can’t take our eyes off the opioid epidemic.
 
These HHS grants will help prevent, treat, and promote recovery from substance abuse in Louisiana’s communities.
 
https://t.co/eY8ikxR6tN

Louisianians are just starting to recover from Hurricane #Laura, and every piece of help for these areas counts.
 
I’m grateful for HHS’s support for our children’s hospitals and for food safety.
 
https://t.co/F9Sr8fn26m

Recently, Boy Scout Matthew Bald collected 1,500 books for DePaul Health's literacy program, which provides used books for children who visit the New Orleans clinic. Louisiana appreciates your generosity, Matthew!
 
https://t.co/I1s6e6lu7T

Portland, Oregon protesters beat a man bloody and unconscious. This makes me sick to my core. Why is the mayor tolerating this?

https://t.co/1YrSQy2L6e

Good news for Louisiana: USDA has made crawfish farmers eligible for relief through the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program and extended the deadline to 9/11. 

Thankful USDA gave ear to the good work and urgent needs of Louisiana’s crawfish industry: https://t.co/uAPepRCfq7 https://t.co/hiu7LNvz4Z

Fraudsters are using the #coronavirus pandemic to target Louisiana’s senior citizens, but Edith’s Bill would help victims recover. 

Thankful to be fighting scam artists alongside @SenBillCassidy and @AGJeffLandry.

A big thank you to @CMSGov for making this right. 

Rural hospitals play a huge role in caring for Louisianians. https://t.co/IV18OTIQor

Louisiana is home to 57 rural hospitals. 44% are currently operating at a loss.

We should be ensuring the survival of America’s rural hospitals during the #coronavirus pandemic, not speeding up their closure.

https://t.co/UyHusCJCQa

A Democratic congressman from our sister state of Massachusetts said that Louisianians and other Southerners are “getting what was coming to them” from COVID-19. 

Why would anyone want someone else to contract the virus?  

https://t.co/ydUU6j7Omx

How did Destrehan High School junior @kailie_carrigee celebrate her 16th birthday? By collecting donations for Second Harvest Food Bank to help feed families impacted by the #coronavirus in the New Orleans area. 

Way to give back, Kailie!
 
https://t.co/rNgPZE4ep1

The most pressing problem we have with the current coronavirus bill is unemployment insurance. We can't pay folks more to stay home than to work, but people need help.

https://t.co/34b8rSXX6t
